name: Acolyte of Xathrid
oracle_text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.
flavor_text: Like all priests, she gives her blessings only to those truly worthy of them.

name: Angel's Mercy
oracle_text: You gain 7 life.
flavor_text:
"Until that day I cursed the angels, those uncaring lights in the sky. They rewarded my scorn with the gift of time, every year of which I've spent in devotion to their names."
—Torian Sha, soul warden

name: Assassinate
oracle_text: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor_text:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin

name: Berserkers of Blood Ridge
oracle_text: Berserkers of Blood Ridge attacks each combat if able.
flavor_text: They take a blood oath to die in battle. So far none have failed to fulfill the promise.

name: Blinding Mage
oracle_text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor_text: "I carry the light of truth. Do not pity those it blinds, for they never had eyes to see."

name: Borderland Ranger
oracle_text: When Borderland Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor_text: "Only fools and bandits use roads."

name: Bountiful Harvest
oracle_text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.
flavor_text: Following the sun's cycle, harvest season comes once a year—unless the druids bid the sun behave otherwise.

name: Bramble Creeper
oracle_text: Whenever Bramble Creeper attacks, it gets +5/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"I've seen the fully grown ones tear a baloth to gory ribbons in seconds."
—Kivi, thornberry harvester

name: Burning Inquiry
oracle_text: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.
flavor_text: Jariad burned the midnight oil, burned through scroll after scroll, and then burned down his laboratory.

name: Burst of Speed
oracle_text: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn. (They can attack and {T} even if they just came under your control.)
flavor_text: Great generals inspire by example. Goblin chieftains inspire by electrifying the barracks.

name: Cancel
oracle_text: Counter target spell.

name: Canyon Minotaur
flavor_text:
"We'll scale these cliffs, traverse Brittle Bridge, and then fight our way down the volcanic slopes on the other side."
"Isn't the shortest route through the canyon?"
"Yes."
"So shouldn't we—"
"No."

name: Centaur Courser
flavor_text:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

name: Child of Night
oracle_text: Lifelink
flavor_text: A vampire enacts vengeance on the entire world, claiming her debt two tiny pinpricks at a time.

name: Convincing Mirage
oracle_text:
Enchant land
As Convincing Mirage enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
flavor_text: "Where are we? You must learn to ask more useful questions than that."

name: Coral Merfolk
flavor_text: Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.

name: Craw Wurm
flavor_text: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

name: Deadly Recluse
oracle_text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

name: Disentomb
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text:
"Stop complaining. You can rest when you're dead. Oh—sorry."
—Liliana Vess

name: Disorient
oracle_text: Target creature gets -7/-0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"If it has a brain, even a primitive one, we can most surely scramble it."
—Garild, merfolk mage

name: Divination
oracle_text: Draw two cards.
flavor_text:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle

name: Divine Verdict
oracle_text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor_text: Giants and pit spawn attempted to topple the cathedral's pillars. The fine grit of their remains still swirls in the breeze outside.

name: Doom Blade
oracle_text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor_text: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.

name: Dread Warlock
oracle_text: Dread Warlock can't be blocked except by black creatures.
flavor_text: "I don't know who to pity more: those who flee from my presence or the damned who can withstand it."

name: Drudge Skeletons
oracle_text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor_text:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, *Necromancer's Handbook*

name: Duress
oracle_text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor_text:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess

name: Elvish Visionary
oracle_text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor_text: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.

name: Emerald Oryx
oracle_text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor_text: After the oryx dies, its flesh returns to the earth, but its emerald bones remain as a tribute to the forest.

name: Entangling Vines
oracle_text:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor_text: Every living thing has roots in nature. Sometimes nature gets its roots into you.

name: Essence Scatter
oracle_text: Counter target creature spell.
flavor_text: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.

name: Excommunicate
oracle_text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor_text:
"Our law prohibits capital punishment. We believe even the gravest offenders have the chance to redeem themselves."
—Torian Sha, soul warden

name: Fiery Hellhound
oracle_text: {R}: Fiery Hellhound gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Once a barbarian army has conquered a region, their shamans summon hellhounds that keep undesirables out and prisoners in.

name: Firebreathing
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The mage breathed in life-giving air and breathed out death-bringing fire.

name: Fog
oracle_text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
flavor_text:
"I fear no army or beast, but only the morning fog. Our assault can survive everything else."
—Lord Hilneth

name: Giant Growth
oracle_text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Giant Spider
oracle_text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor_text: The giant spider's silk naturally resists gravity, almost weaving itself as it blankets the forest canopy.

name: Glorious Charge
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"One's blade is only as sharp as one's conviction."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Goblin Piker
flavor_text: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

name: Gravedigger
oracle_text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.

name: Griffin Sentinel
oracle_text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor_text: Once a griffin sentinel adopts a territory as its own, only death can force it to betray its post.

name: Holy Strength
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
flavor_text:
"Born under the sun, the first child will seek the foundation of honor and be fortified by its righteousness."
—Codex of the Constellari

name: Horned Turtle
flavor_text: It's a mistake to say turtles hide in their shells. They merely need time to contemplate how best to bite your head off.

name: Ice Cage
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy Ice Cage.

name: Illusionary Servant
oracle_text:
Flying
When Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor_text:
"Illusion is a handy but fragile medium. Use it only in a pinch, or against the dim-witted."
—Jace Beleren

name: Jackal Familiar
oracle_text: Jackal Familiar can't attack or block alone.
flavor_text:
"Let the gray-hairs keep their ravens and drakes. My familiar will be a reflection of me: bloodthirsty, with a predator's instinct."
—Taivang, barbarian warlord

name: Jump
oracle_text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Humanity has always envied the power of flight. So we took it."
—Scytha, aeromage

name: Kelinore Bat
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: The nesting bats of Kelinore sleep soundly while the sun passes, nestled among their grisly collections.

name: Kindled Fury
oracle_text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Rage is a dangerous weapon. Your enemies will try to use your anger against you. Use it against them first."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Lava Axe
oracle_text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor_text: "Catch!"

name: Lifelink
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
flavor_text: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.

name: Lightning Bolt
oracle_text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor_text: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.

name: Lightning Elemental
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave, He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

name: Llanowar Elves
oracle_text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor_text:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

name: Looming Shade
oracle_text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.

name: Merfolk Looter
oracle_text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor_text: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.

name: Mind Rot
oracle_text: Target player discards two cards.
flavor_text:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

name: Mist Leopard
oracle_text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text:
"I can't claim to hunt all creatures. There are some things in the jungle that simply can't be hunted."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Naturalize
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor_text: If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.

name: Negate
oracle_text: Counter target noncreature spell.
flavor_text: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

name: Oakenform
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
flavor_text:
"When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

name: Pacifism
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
flavor_text: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

name: Palace Guard
oracle_text: Palace Guard can block any number of creatures.
flavor_text: "I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."

name: Panic Attack
oracle_text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
flavor_text:
"What do they see in the throes of panic? I'm not sure I want to know."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer

name: Ponder
oracle_text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.

name: Raging Goblin
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

name: Rampant Growth
oracle_text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor_text: Nature grows solutions to its problems.

name: Razorfoot Griffin
oracle_text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor_text: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.

name: Regenerate
oracle_text: Regenerate target creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor_text: "This wound shall be like the chills of winter: swiftly forgotten when spring shoots rise."

name: Runeclaw Bear
flavor_text: Bears aren't always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.

name: Safe Passage
oracle_text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and creatures you control this turn.
flavor_text: With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.

name: Sage Owl
oracle_text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor_text: Some owls house the souls of archmages of ages past.

name: Seismic Strike
oracle_text: Seismic Strike deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
flavor_text:
"Life up here is simple. Adapt to the ways of the mountains and they will reward you. Fight them and they will end you."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer

name: Serpent of the Endless Sea
oracle_text:
Serpent of the Endless Sea's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Islands you control.
Serpent of the Endless Sea can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

name: Shatter
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact.
flavor_text: Days of planning. Weeks of building. Months of perfecting. Seconds of smashing.

name: Siege Mastodon
flavor_text:
"Defending the citadel is easy. I just take these big fellows outside the main gate and let the enemy take a good long look."
—Mastodon keeper

name: Sign in Blood
oracle_text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
flavor_text:
"You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"
—Xathrid demon

name: Silvercoat Lion
flavor_text: Hunters of every species on the savannah, silvercoats disdain camouflage in favor of total dominance of the food chain.

name: Snapping Drake
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.

name: Solemn Offering
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.
flavor_text:
"A relic donation is suggested."
"The suggestion is mandatory."
—Temple signs

name: Soul Bleed
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 1 life.
flavor_text: Whether the end comes swift or slow, it always comes too soon.

name: Soul Warden
oracle_text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."

name: Sparkmage Apprentice
oracle_text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Sparkmages are performance artists of sorts, but pain is the price of admission.

name: Stampeding Rhino
oracle_text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor_text:
"Sometimes I wonder if our weapons and armor are a step backward."
—Soron, rhox pikemaster

name: Stormfront Pegasus
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text:
"At summer's end, the pegasus herd stampedes across the sky. Their silent footfalls taunt the clouds and bid the rains to come."
—Stormfront fable

name: Tendrils of Corruption
oracle_text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
flavor_text: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.

name: Terramorphic Expanse
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

name: Tome Scour
oracle_text: Target player mills five cards.
flavor_text: Genius is overrated, especially when it's someone else's.

name: Trumpet Blast
oracle_text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.

name: Unholy Strength
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
flavor_text:
"Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart."
—Codex of the Constellari

name: Unsummon
oracle_text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It's only fair that they occasionally throw one back.

name: Vampire Aristocrat
oracle_text: Sacrifice a creature: Vampire Aristocrat gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text: "I admit, I am a creature of the city. The sights, the nightly excitement, the abundance of fine drink . . ."

name: Veteran Armorsmith
oracle_text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +0/+1.
flavor_text: "Courage is a proud and gleaming shield. It does not bend or hide from sight. To fight with courage, we must forge in steel."

name: Veteran Swordsmith
oracle_text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+0.
flavor_text: "Truth is a straight, keen edge. There are no soft angles or rounded edges. To fight for truth, we must forge in steel."

name: Viashino Spearhunter
oracle_text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor_text: Viashino lack the majesty of their draconic ancestors, but they lash out with equal rage and twice the spite.

name: Wall of Faith
oracle_text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Wall of Faith gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"This is a fine suit, armorsmith. I will be safe from harm. If only you could forge rings to mail the rest of my people . . ."
—Lord Hilneth

name: Warpath Ghoul
flavor_text: The battle was over, but the carnage continued for days.

name: Weakness
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
flavor_text: "For strength to have any meaning, there must also be . . . you."

name: Wind Drake
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: A smaller cousin to the dragon, drakes are often seen at the side of powerful wizards who use them as airborne eyes and ears.

name: Yawning Fissure
oracle_text: Each opponent sacrifices a land.
flavor_text: The mapmaker scowled. He sighed, unrolled his parchment, and painted a large black blob where the Eternal Meadow was once marked.

name: Zephyr Sprite
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: "I've never understood why so many beings lumber around on the ground. There are three dimensions, yet they use only two."

name: Zombie Goliath
flavor_text:
"Phirax of Blood Ridge has sent a war giant at us? What, do I have to spell it out for you? Kill the giant, scoop out its skull, and drive it back to Blood Ridge. Honestly, what kind of necromancer minions are you?"
—Keren-Dur, necromancer lord
